discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Had a lab open, and attempted to test it using the wizard.

A. The VPC will create a routing instance and attach it with a public subnet - No
B. The VPC will create two subnets - Yes, can be configuratble
C. The VPC will create one internet gateway and attach it to VPC - Yes, if you select 1 or more public subnets
D. The VPC will launch one NAT instance with an elastic IP - No, Will launch a NAT gateway, not an instance. An Elastic IP is attached to the NAT Gateway. This option is not on by default, and is configurable either in 1 AZ or per AZ

Selected Answer: A
A. Is false. Are there "routing instances"?
B. Is correct
C. Is correct
D. Is false?? The VPC will launch one NAT instance with an elastic IP => now, the wizard seems to create a nat gateway (https://www.bogotobogo.com/DevOps/AWS/aws-VPC-Virtual-Private-Cloud-3-VPC-Wizard-with-NAT.php)

Correct Answer: A 
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/VPC_Scenario2.html
"You can use the VPC wizard to create the VPC, subnets, NAT gateway, and optionally, an egress-only internet gateway. You must specify an Elastic IP address for your NAT gateway; if you don't have one, you must first allocate one to your account. If you want to use an existing Elastic IP address, ensure that it's not currently associated with another instance or network interface. The NAT gateway is automatically created in the public subnet of your VPC. "

A. Is correct. At first thought I assumed D. However I found this page

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/VPC_Scenario2.html
A. The VPC will create a routing instance and attach it with a public subnet

choices.C: The VPC will create one internet gateway and attach it to VPC
choices.B: The VPC will create two subnets
choices.A: The VPC will create a routing instance and attach it with a public subnet
choices.D: The VPC will launch one NAT instance with an elastic IP

questions.question_text: A user has created a VPC with public and private subnets using the VPC wizard. Which of the below mentioned statements is not true in this scenario?
questions.answer_description: A user can create a subnet with VPC and launch instances inside that subnet. If the user has created a public private subnet, the instances in the public subnet can receive inbound traffic directly from the internet, whereas the instances in the private subnet cannot. If these subnets are created with Wizard, AWS will create a NAT instance with an elastic IP. Wizard will also create two subnets with route tables. It will also create an internet gateway and attach it to the VPC.

discussion.content:

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/latest/classic/enable-proxy-protocol.html
Correct Answer: A

it's A
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/latest/classic/elb-listener-config.html

questions.question_text: A user has configured ELB with a TCP listener at ELB as well as on the back-end instances. The user wants to enable a proxy protocol to capture the source and destination IP information in the header. Which of the below mentioned statements helps the user understand a proxy protocol with TCP configuration?
questions.answer_description:
When the user has configured Transmission Control Protocol (TCP. or Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) for both front-end and back-end connections of the Elastic
Load Balancer, the load balancer forwards the request to the back-end instances without modifying the request headers unless the proxy header is enabled. If the end user is requesting from a Proxy Protocol enabled proxy server, then the ELB admin should not enable the Proxy Protocol on the load balancer. If the Proxy
Protocol is enabled on both the proxy server and the load balancer, the load balancer will add another header to the request which already has a header from the proxy server. This duplication may result in errors.

choices.A: If the end user is requesting behind a proxy server then the user should not enable a proxy protocol on ELB
choices.D: If the end user is requesting behind the proxy, then the user should add the ג€isproxyג€ flag to the ELB Configuration
choices.C: Whether the end user is requesting from a proxy server or directly, it does not make a difference for the proxy protocol
choices.B: ELB does not support a proxy protocol when it is listening on both the load balancer and the back-end instances

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
it will throw an error

comments.content: i agree with you, partial, but not throw an error ? after throwing an error, you can request more ElasticIPs in your Region.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I go with A
By default, all AWS accounts are limited to five (5) Elastic IP addresses per Region, because public (IPv4) internet addresses are a scarce public resource. We strongly encourage you to use an Elastic IP address primarily for the ability to remap the address to another instance in the case of instance failure, and to use DNS hostnames for all other inter-node communication.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/elastic-ip-addresses-eip.html
D. The user can allocate a new IP address in VPC as it has a different limit than EC2

choices.B: AWS allows 10 EC2 Classic IPs per region; so it will allow to allocate new Elastic IPs to the same region
choices.A: The user has to request AWS to increase the number of elastic IPs associated with the account
choices.C: The AWS will not allow to create a new elastic IP in VPC; it will throw an error
choices.D: The user can allocate a new IP address in VPC as it has a different limit than EC2

questions.answer_description:
Section: (none)
A Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) is a virtual network dedicated to the user's AWS account. A user can create a subnet with VPC and launch instances inside that subnet. A user can have 5 IP addresses per region with EC2 Classic. The user can have 5 separate IPs with VPC in the same region as it has a separate limit than EC2 Classic.
questions.question_text: A user has launched 5 instances in EC2-CLASSIC and attached 5 elastic IPs to the five different instances in the US East region. The user is creating a VPC in the same region. The user wants to assign an elastic IP to the VPC instance. How can the user achieve this?

A user has created a subnet in VPC and launched an EC2 instance within it. The user has not selected the option to assign the IP address while launching the instance. Which of the below mentioned statements is true with respect to this scenario?

choices.B: The user can directly attach an elastic IP to the instance
choices.D: The user would need to create an Internet gateway and then attach an elastic IP to the instance to connect from internet
choices.A: The instance will always have a public DNS attached to the instance by default
choices.C: The instance will never launch if the public IP is not assigned

questions.answer_description: A Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) is a virtual network dedicated to the user's AWS account. A user can create a subnet with VPC and launch instances inside that subnet. When the user is launching an instance he needs to select an option which attaches a public IP to the instance. If the user has not selected the option to attach the public IP, then it will only have a private IP when launched. The user cannot connect to the instance from the internet. If the user wants an elastic IP to connect to the instance from the Internet, he should create an internet gateway and assign an elastic IP to instance.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I think B is the correct answer

Selected Answer: D
You have to setup IGW first then you can assign Elastic IP to the EC2

I would go with B
you use a NAT GW and IGW to have the private IP talk to Internet.
So to talk to the Internet having private IP is not the only way.
D seems correct.

comments.content:
Why can't you use a NAT GW and IGW to have the private IP talk to Interner.
So to talk to the Internet having private IP is not the only way.

discussion.content:
Correct Answer: D
Please notice that option D shows that is necessary both EIP and IGW to connect FROM internet. That makes all the difference, since the connection source is external.
"If the user has not selected the option to attach the public IP, then it will only have a private IP when launched. The user cannot connect to the instance from the internet. If the user wants an elastic IP to connect to the instance from the Internet, he should create an internet gateway and assign an elastic IP to instance."

comments.content: Agree, IGW is not a mandatory requirement to associate EIP to an instance.

discussion.content: Isn't B? We can associate an elastic IP to an instance. I find IGW option irrelevant to scenario
D. The user would need to create an Internet gateway and then attach an elastic IP to the instance to connect
Correct answer is C.
Correct Answer: C
C is the "AdministratorAccess" policy
C. It allows full access to all AWS services for the IAM users who are a part of this group

questions.question_text:
An organization has applied the below mentioned policy on an IAM group which has selected the IAM users. What entitlements do the IAM users avail with this policy?
//IMG//

choices.A: The policy is not created correctly. It will throw an error for wrong resource name
choices.C: It allows full access to all AWS services for the IAM users who are a part of this group
choices.B: The policy is for the group. Thus, the IAM user cannot have any entitlement to this
choices.D: If this policy is applied to the EC2 resource, the users of the group will have full access to the EC2 Resources

questions.answer_description: AWS Identity and Access Management is a web service which allows organizations to manage users and user permissions for various AWS services. The IAM group allows the organization to specify permissions for a collection of users. With the below mentioned policy, it will allow the group full access (Admin to all AWS services).
